Book Description:

After all, men and women had been having sex, marrying, building families, and sometimes even falling in love for millennia without having any special name for their emotions or acts. Yet, within half a century, Ã¢â‚¬Å“heterosexualÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ had become a byword for Ã¢â‚¬Å“normal,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ enshrined in law, medicine, psychiatry, and the media as a new gold standard for human experience.
